alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 1:22PM CST until January 28 at 5:08PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Tombigbee River near Amory For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Tombigbee River at Bigbee, Tombigbee River near Amory, Tombigbee River Aberdeen L & D... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Friday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 20.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued late Saturday night at 130 AM CST.
